t: Psalm 119
Delight in God’s Word
א Aleph
How*pn happy are those whose way is blameless, who*ln walk according to the Lord’s*s instruction!
Happy*ln are those who keep his decrees and*ln seek him with all their heart.
They*ln do nothing wrong; they*ln walk in his ways.
You*ln have commanded that your precepts be*ln diligently kept.
If*ln only my ways were committed to*ln keeping your statutes!
Then*ln I would not be ashamed when*ln I think about all your commands.
I*ln will praise you with an upright heart when*ln I learn your righteous judgments.
I*ln will keep your statutes; never*ln abandon me.
ב Beth
How*pn can a young man keep his way pure? By*ln keeping your word.
I*ln have sought you with all my heart; don’t*ln let me wander from your commands.
I*ln have treasured your word in my heart so*ln that I may not sin against you.
Lord,*sln may you be blessed; teach*ln me your statutes.
With*ln my lips I proclaim all*ln the judgments from your mouth.
I*ln rejoice in the way revealed by your decrees as*ln much as in all riches.
I*ln will meditate on your precepts and*ln think about your ways.
I*ln will delight in your statutes; I*ln will not forget your word.
ג Gimel
Deal*pn generously with your servant so*ln that I might live; then*ln I will keep your word.
Open*ln my eyes so that I may contemplate wondrous*ln things from your instruction.
I*ln am a resident alien on earth; do*ln not hide your commands from me.
I*ln am continually overcome with*ln longing for your judgments.
You*ln rebuke the arrogant, the*ln ones under a curse, who*ln wander from your commands.
Take*ln insult and contempt away from me, for*ln I have kept your decrees.
Though*ln princes sit together speaking against me, your*ln servant will think about your statutes;
your*ln decrees are my delight and*ln my counselors.
ד Daleth
My*pn life is down in the dust; give*ln me life through your word.
I*ln told you about my life, and*ln you answered me; teach*ln me your statutes.
Help*ln me understand the*ln meaning of your precepts so*ln that I can meditate on your wonders.
I*ln am weary from grief; strengthen*ln me through your word.
Keep*ln me from the way of deceit and*ln graciously give me your instruction.
I*ln have chosen the way of truth; I*ln have set your ordinances before me.
I*ln cling to your decrees; Lord,*sln do not put me to shame.
I*ln pursue the way of your commands, for*ln you broaden my understanding.
ה He
Teach*pn me, Lord,*s the meaning of your statutes, and*ln I will always keep them.
Help*ln me understand your instruction, and*ln I will obey it and*ln follow it with all my heart.
Help*ln me stay on the path of your commands, for*ln I take pleasure in it.
Turn*ln my heart to your decrees and*ln not to dishonest profit.
Turn*ln my eyes from*ln looking at what is worthless; give*ln me life in your ways.
Confirm*ln what you said to your servant, for*ln it produces reverence for you.
Turn*ln away the disgrace I dread; indeed,*ln your judgments are good.
How*ln I long for your precepts! Give*ln me life through your righteousness.
ו Waw
Let*pn your faithful love come to me, Lord,*s your*ln salvation, as you promised.
Then*ln I can answer the one who taunts me, for*ln I trust in your word.
Never*ln take the word of truth from my mouth, for*ln I hope in your judgments.
I*ln will always obey your instruction, forever*ln and ever.
I*ln will walk freely in an open place because*ln I study your precepts.
I*ln will speak of your decrees before kings and*ln not be ashamed.
I*ln delight in your commands, which*ln I love.
I*ln will lift up my hands to your commands, which*ln I love, and*ln will meditate on your statutes.
ז Zayin
Remember*pn your word to your servant; you*ln have given me hope through it.
This*ln is my comfort in my affliction: Your*ln promise has given me life.
The*ln arrogant constantly ridicule me, but*ln I do not turn away from your instruction.
Lord,*sln I remember your judgments from long ago and*ln find comfort.
Fury*ln seizes me because of the wicked who*ln reject your instruction.
Your*ln statutes are the theme of my song during*ln my earthly life.
Lord,*sln I remember your name in the night, and*ln I obey your instruction.
This*ln is my practice: I*ln obey your precepts.
ח Cheth
The*pn Lord*s is my portion; I*ln have promised to keep your words.
I*ln have sought your favor with all my heart; be*ln gracious to me according to your promise.
I*ln thought about my ways and*ln turned my steps back to your decrees.
I*ln hurried, not hesitating to*ln keep your commands.
Though*ln the ropes of the wicked were*ln wrapped around me, I*ln did not forget your instruction.
I*ln rise at midnight to thank you for*ln your righteous judgments.
I*ln am a friend to all who fear you, to*ln those who keep your precepts.
Lord,*sln the earth is filled with your faithful love; teach*ln me your statutes.
ט Teth
Lord,*spn you have treated your servant well, just*ln as you promised.
Teach*ln me good judgment and discernment, for*ln I rely on your commands.
Before*ln I was afflicted I went astray, but*ln now I keep your word.
You*ln are good, and you do what is good; teach*ln me your statutes.
The*ln arrogant have smeared me with lies, but*ln I obey your precepts with all my heart.
Their*ln hearts are hard and insensitive, but*ln I delight in your instruction.
It*ln was good for me to be afflicted so*ln that I could learn your statutes.
Instruction*ln from your lips is better for me than*ln thousands of gold and silver pieces.
י Yod
Your*pn hands made me and formed me; give*ln me understanding so*ln that I can learn your commands.
Those*ln who fear you will see me and rejoice, for*ln I put my hope in your word.
I*ln know, Lord,*s that your judgments are just and*ln that you have afflicted me fairly.
May*ln your faithful love comfort me as*ln you promised your servant.
May*ln your compassion come to me so*ln that I may live, for*ln your instruction is my delight.
Let*ln the arrogant be put to shame for*ln slandering me with lies; I*ln will meditate on your precepts.
Let*ln those who fear you, those*ln who know your decrees, turn to me.
May*ln my heart be blameless regarding your statutes so*ln that I will not be put to shame.
כ Kaph
I*pn long for your salvation; I*ln put my hope in your word.
My*ln eyes grow weary looking*ln for what you have promised; I*ln ask, “When will you comfort me?”
Though*ln I have become like a wineskin dried by smoke, I*ln do not forget your statutes.
How*ln many days must your servant wait? When*ln will you execute judgment on my persecutors?
The*ln arrogant have dug pits for me; they*ln violate your instruction.
All*ln your commands are true; people*ln persecute me with lies — help me!
They*ln almost ended my life on earth, but*ln I did not abandon your precepts.
Give*ln me life in accordance with your faithful love, and*ln I will obey the decree you have spoken.
ל Lamed
Lord,*spn your word is forever; it*ln is firmly fixed in heaven.
Your*ln faithfulness is for all generations; you*ln established the earth, and it stands firm.
Your*ln judgments stand firm today, for*ln all things are your servants.
If*ln your instruction had not been my delight, I*ln would have died in my affliction.
I*ln will never forget your precepts, for*ln you have given me life through them.
I*ln am yours; save me, for*ln I have studied your precepts.
The*ln wicked hope to destroy me, but*ln I contemplate your decrees.
I*ln have seen a limit to all perfection, but*ln your command is without limit.
מ Mem
How*pn I love your instruction! It*ln is my meditation all day long.
Your*ln command makes me wiser than my enemies, for*ln it is always with me.
I*ln have more insight than all my teachers because*ln your decrees are my meditation.
I*ln understand more than the elders because*ln I obey your precepts.
I*ln have kept my feet from every evil path to*ln follow your word.
I*ln have not turned from your judgments, for*ln you yourself have instructed me.
How*ln sweet your word is to my taste — sweeter*ln than honey in my mouth.
I*ln gain understanding from your precepts; therefore*ln I hate every false way.
נ Nun
Your*pn word is a lamp for my feet and*ln a light on my path.
I*ln have solemnly sworn to*ln keep your righteous judgments.
I*ln am severely afflicted; Lord,*sln give me life according to your word.
Lord,*sln please accept my freewill offerings of praise, and*ln teach me your judgments.
My*ln life is constantly in danger, yet*ln I do not forget your instruction.
The*ln wicked have set a trap for me, but*ln I have not wandered from your precepts.
I*ln have your decrees as a heritage forever; indeed,*ln they are the joy of my heart.
I*ln am resolved to obey your statutes to*ln the very end.
ס Samek
I*pn hate those who are double-minded, but*ln I love your instruction.
You*ln are my shelter and my shield; I*ln put my hope in your word.
Depart*ln from me, you evil ones, so*ln that I may obey my God’s commands.
Sustain*ln me as you promised, and I will live; do*ln not let me be ashamed of my hope.
Sustain*ln me so that I can be safe and*ln always be concerned about your statutes.
You*ln reject all who stray from your statutes, for*ln their deceit is a lie.
You*ln remove all the wicked on earth as*ln if they were dross from metal; therefore,*ln I love your decrees.
I*ln tremble in awe of you; I*ln fear your judgments.
ע Ayin
I*pn have done what is just and right; do*ln not leave me to my oppressors.
Guarantee*ln your servant’s well-being; do*ln not let the arrogant oppress me.
My*ln eyes grow weary looking for your salvation and*ln for your righteous promise.
Deal*ln with your servant based on your faithful love; teach*ln me your statutes.
I*ln am your servant; give me understanding so*ln that I may know your decrees.
It*ln is time for the Lord*s to act, for*ln they have violated your instruction.
Since*ln I love your commands more*ln than gold, even the purest gold,
I*ln carefully follow all your precepts and*ln hate every false way.
פ Pe
Your*pn decrees are wondrous; therefore*ln I obey them.
The*ln revelation of your words brings light and*ln gives understanding to the inexperienced.
I*ln open my mouth and pant because*ln I long for your commands.
Turn*ln to me and be gracious to me, as*ln is your practice toward those who love your name.
Make*ln my steps steady through your promise; don’t*ln let any sin dominate me.
Redeem*ln me from human oppression, and*ln I will keep your precepts.
Make*ln your face shine on your servant, and*ln teach me your statutes.
My*ln eyes pour out streams of tears because*ln people do not follow your instruction.
צ Tsade
You*pn are righteous, Lord,*s and*ln your judgments are just.
The*ln decrees you issue are righteous and*ln altogether trustworthy.
My*ln anger overwhelms me because*ln my foes forget your words.
Your*ln word is completely pure, and*ln your servant loves it.
I*ln am insignificant and despised, but*ln I do not forget your precepts.
Your*ln righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and*ln your instruction is true.
Trouble*ln and distress have overtaken me, but*ln your commands are my delight.
Your*ln decrees are righteous forever. Give*ln me understanding, and I will live.

I*pn call with all my heart; answer me, Lord.*s I*ln will obey your statutes.
I*ln call to you; save me, and*ln I will keep your decrees.
I*ln rise before dawn and cry out for help; I*ln put my hope in your word.
I*ln am awake through each watch of the night to*ln meditate on your promise.

Long*ln ago I learned from your decrees that*ln you have established them forever.
ר Resh
Consider*pn my affliction and rescue me, for*ln I have not forgotten your instruction.
Champion*ln my cause and redeem me; give*ln me life as you promised.
Salvation*ln is far from the wicked because*ln they do not study your statutes.
Your*ln compassions are many, Lord;*s give*ln me life according to your judgments.

The*ln entirety of your word is truth, each*ln of your righteous judgments endures forever.
שׂ Sin
Princes*pn have persecuted me without cause, but*ln my heart fears only your word.

I*ln hate and abhor falsehood, but*ln I love your instruction.

ת Taw
Let*pn my cry reach you, Lord;*s give*ln me understanding according to your word.

I*ln wander like a lost sheep; seek*ln your servant, for*ln I do not forget your commands.
